title: Call to Thread run() instead of start()
overview: In most cases a direct call to a Thread object&#x27;s run() method is a bug. The programmer intended to begin a new thread of control, but accidentally called run() instead of start(), so the run() method will execute in the caller&#x27;s thread of control.
remediation: ::PHASE:Implementation:STRATEGY::EFFECTIVENESS::DESCRIPTION:Use the start() method instead of the run() method.::
